abstract: Seth Schiesel Critic's Notebook on app-laden version of Bjork's new release Biophilia, which lets listeners manipulate the music; holds that what Bjork has accomplished with her latest conception is among the most creative, innovative and important new projects in popular culture; notes that Biophilia essentially turns an album into a sort of audiovisual game, delivering a miniature production studio into the world's willing hands.
snippet: The app-laden version of Bjork’s new release, “Biophilia,” lets listeners manipulate the music.
lead_paragraph: The app-laden version of Bjork’s new release, “Biophilia,” lets listeners manipulate the music.

headline.main: Playing the New Bjork Album, and Playing Along, With Apps
headline.print_headline: Playing the New Bjork Album, And Playing Along, With Apps
